terminology.EKF: Extended Kalman Filter - probabilistic state estimator that fuses noisy sensor measurements to estimate vehicle position, velocity, and attitude
terminology.Innovation: Difference between actual sensor measurement and EKF predicted measurement, used to detect sensor faults
terminology.Innovation Test Ratio: Normalized innovation statistic (innovation / expected_noise), values >1 indicate unexpected sensor behavior
terminology.NED Frame: North-East-Down coordinate system used by PX4 - positive X=North, Y=East, Z=Down (different from typical aerospace)
terminology.Body Frame: Vehicle-fixed coordinate system - positive X=forward, Y=right, Z=down
terminology.PWM: Pulse Width Modulation - signal to control motor speed, typically 1000-2000 microseconds (μs)
terminology.ESC: Electronic Speed Controller - converts PWM signal to three-phase AC for brushless motors
terminology.PID Controller: Proportional-Integral-Derivative controller used for attitude and rate control
terminology.Rate Controller: Inner loop controller that commands angular velocity (deg/s) to achieve desired attitude
terminology.Attitude Controller: Outer loop controller that commands desired angular velocity based on attitude error
terminology.C-Rating: Battery discharge rate capability - 50C means battery can discharge at 50× its capacity (e.g., 1000mAh @ 50C = 50A)
terminology.Internal Resistance: Battery's inherent resistance causing voltage drop under load, increases with age
terminology.Cell Count: Number of lithium cells in series (1S=3.7V, 2S=7.4V, 3S=11.1V, 4S=14.8V, 6S=22.2V)
terminology.Loiter: Position hold mode using GPS - maintains current position and altitude
terminology.RTL: Return to Launch - autonomous flight back to takeoff location and landing
terminology.Stabilized: Angle-mode flight where pilot commands attitude angles, autopilot stabilizes
terminology.Acro: Rate-mode flight where pilot directly commands angular velocities, no self-leveling
terminology.Position Control: GPS-enabled mode where pilot commands velocity, autopilot maintains position
terminology.Altitude Control: Barometer/GPS altitude hold, pilot commands horizontal velocity
terminology.Failsafe: Automatic safety action triggered by critical event (RC loss, battery low, GPS loss, etc.)
terminology.Arming: Enabling motors for flight - safety check that must pass before motors spin
terminology.Geofence: Virtual boundary that triggers failsafe if vehicle exits defined area
terminology.Nav State: PX4 internal flight mode enumeration (0=MANUAL, 2=POSCTL, 3=AUTO_MISSION, 5=RTL, etc.)
terminology.Land Detected: Boolean flag indicating if vehicle is on ground (uses thrust, velocity, and barometer)
terminology.Saturation: Controller output hitting maximum limit - indicates insufficient control authority
terminology.Tilt Error: Combined roll and pitch angle error - sqrt(roll_error² + pitch_error²)
terminology.Tracking Error: Difference between commanded and actual vehicle state
terminology.IMU: Inertial Measurement Unit - contains accelerometers and gyroscopes
terminology.Gyroscope: Measures angular velocity (rotation rate) in deg/s or rad/s
terminology.Accelerometer: Measures linear acceleration including gravity in m/s²
terminology.Magnetometer: Measures magnetic field strength, used for compass heading
terminology.Barometer: Measures atmospheric pressure, used for altitude estimation
terminology.PSD: Power Spectral Density - frequency domain analysis showing vibration energy at different frequencies
terminology.RMS: Root Mean Square - statistical measure of signal magnitude over time
terminology.Thrust-to-Weight Ratio: Maximum thrust divided by vehicle weight, should be >2:1 for responsive multirotor
terminology.ULog: PX4 binary log format containing timestamped topic messages
terminology.Topic: Named data stream in ULog (e.g., vehicle_attitude, sensor_gyro)
terminology.Timestamp: Time in microseconds (μs) since boot, converted to seconds for analysis

battery_sag.definition: Voltage drop below baseline during high thrust load, indicating battery degradation or insufficient capacity
battery_sag.detection_method: Compare instantaneous voltage to 10-second EMA baseline during high thrust periods (>60%)
battery_sag.normal_behavior: Voltage should remain stable with minimal sag (<0.5V) under normal load
common_causes: Aged battery cells with high internal resistance (>200 charge cycles)
Cold weather reducing battery capacity (<10°C)
Undersized battery for current draw (C-rating too low)
Loose power connections (XT60/XT90 connectors)
remediation_steps: Check battery cycle count and physical condition (no swelling)
Measure internal resistance (should be <10mΩ per cell)
Use battery warmer in cold conditions (target 20°C+)
Upgrade to higher C-rating battery (50C+ recommended)
Inspect and clean all power connectors
battery_sag.severity_impact: Can lead to ESC brown-out and motor dropout

motor_dropout.definition: Single motor output collapse while other motors remain operational, often flight-ending event
motor_dropout.detection_method: Two-gate logic: (1) Motor PWM <10% while average >60%, AND (2) Corroboration from voltage sag, ESC RPM, or compensatory thrust increase
motor_dropout.normal_behavior: All motors respond proportionally to thrust commands with <5% variance

thresholds.critical: Always critical - motor dropout is flight-ending

common_causes: ESC brown-out from battery voltage sag (most common)
ESC overheating entering protection mode (>80°C)
Motor bearing seizure from contamination or wear
Broken motor wire or poor solder joint
ESC firmware desync event
remediation_steps: Inspect ESC for burn marks, swollen capacitors, or heat damage
Test motor bearings for roughness (should spin freely)
Measure motor winding resistance with multimeter (<1Ω difference between phases)
Check ESC signal wire connections and solder joints
Update ESC firmware to latest stable version
Replace ESC if bench test shows failures
motor_dropout.severity_impact: Immediate loss of control authority, emergency landing required

tracking_error.definition: Persistent difference between commanded and actual vehicle attitude, indicating control issues
tracking_error.detection_method: Rolling RMS of tilt error (sqrt(roll_error² + pitch_error²)) over 5-second window
tracking_error.normal_behavior: RMS tracking error should be <3° during stable flight in calm conditions
common_causes: PID tuning too aggressive causing oscillations or too soft allowing drift
Strong wind gusts exceeding available control authority
Motor/propeller imbalance creating constant disturbance
ESC desync events or timing issues
Center of gravity offset from thrust axis
remediation_steps: Run PX4 autotune in calm conditions (<5 m/s wind)
If oscillating, reduce rate P and D gains by 10-20%
If sluggish, increase rate P gain by 10%
Balance all propellers using prop balancer tool
Check motor timing and advance settings in ESC
Verify CG is within 5mm of geometric center
Lower maximum tilt angle (MPC_TILTMAX_AIR) if wind sensitivity
tracking_error.severity_impact: Poor flight performance, increased battery consumption, potential crash in wind

ekf_spike.definition: Sudden increase in Extended Kalman Filter innovation test ratios, indicating sensor or estimation inconsistency
ekf_spike.detection_method: Monitor innovation test ratios across all channels (position, velocity, magnetometer, height), flag when max >2.5 for >0.5s
ekf_spike.normal_behavior: Innovation test ratios should remain <1.0 during stable flight with good sensor data
common_causes: GPS glitches from signal loss, multipath, or interference
Magnetometer interference from nearby metal, power lines, or motor currents
Accelerometer spike from hard landing, collision, or vibration
Barometer step change from building wind shadow or rapid altitude change
Poor sensor calibration or mounting
remediation_steps: Check GPS signal quality (need 10+ satellites, HDOP <1.5)
Recalibrate magnetometer away from metal and electronics
Enable stricter EKF GPS checks (EKF2_GPS_CHECK parameter)
Add foam cover over barometer for wind protection
Verify IMU mounting is rigid (no flex or foam isolation)
Check for electrical noise on sensor power rails
Consider disabling magnetometer if consistent interference (EKF2_MAG_TYPE=5)
ekf_spike.severity_impact: Can cause position estimate drift or EKF failsafe trigger

vibration.definition: Excessive mechanical oscillation in specific frequency bands, detected via gyroscope power spectral density analysis
vibration.detection_method: Welch PSD on raw gyro data, identify peaks >10dB above baseline in 40-250Hz band
vibration.normal_behavior: Gyro PSD should show flat baseline with no sharp peaks exceeding 10dB
common_causes: Unbalanced propellers - most common cause (40-80Hz)
Loose motor mounting screws allowing wobble (80-150Hz)
Bent motor shaft from crash or hard landing (varies)
Frame resonance at specific frequency (100-250Hz)
Damaged propeller with crack or chip (varies)
remediation_steps: Balance all propellers using magnetic prop balancer
Tighten motor mounting screws to manufacturer spec (typically 1.5-2Nm)
Inspect motor shafts for bending (roll shaft on flat surface)
Replace any damaged or worn propellers
Add soft motor mounts if frame resonance suspected
Check for loose frame parts or cracked carbon fiber
vibration.severity_impact: Degrades sensor quality, can cause EKF spikes and attitude control issues

saturation.definition: Rate controller or actuator output hitting limits, indicating insufficient control authority or over-aggressive tuning
saturation.detection_method: Monitor rate_ctrl_status.saturation or infer from PWM signals near limits, flag if mean >40% for >2s
saturation.normal_behavior: Saturation should occur briefly during aggressive maneuvers but remain <20% of total flight time
common_causes: Insufficient motor/propeller thrust margin for vehicle weight
PID tuning too aggressive causing overshoot to limits
Heavy wind requiring full control authority continuously
Damaged or weak motor reducing available thrust
Battery voltage sag reducing motor performance
remediation_steps: Calculate thrust-to-weight ratio (should be >2:1 for multirotors)
Upgrade to larger motors or higher pitch propellers if TWR insufficient
Reduce maximum tilt angle (MPC_TILTMAX_AIR) to limit aggression
Lower rate P gains by 10-20% to reduce overshoot
Check motor condition (bearings, timing, cogging)
Ensure battery can deliver required current without sag
Avoid flying in wind exceeding 50% of max speed capability
saturation.frequency: common in underpowered or over-tuned vehicles
saturation.severity_impact: Limits control authority, can lead to crashes in wind or during aggressive maneuvers

normal_ranges.tracking_error_rms: < 3° during stable hover in calm wind
normal_ranges.vibration_peak: < 10 dB above baseline across 40-250 Hz band

sequence: Aged battery shows voltage sag under load
Voltage drops below ESC brown-out threshold (~10.5V for 3S)
Single ESC resets, motor output drops to zero
Vehicle loses control authority, rapid descent or spin
failure_patterns.prevention: Replace battery before 200 cycles, monitor voltage sag

sequence: Unbalanced prop or loose motor creates vibration
EKF innovation test ratios spike on accelerometer channel
Position estimate drift or EKF failsafe trigger
failure_patterns.prevention: Balance props, secure motor mounts, vibration isolation

sequence: Strong wind gust requires full control authority
Rate controller saturates trying to maintain attitude
Vehicle drifts with wind, tracking error increases
Possible loss of position or crash if sustained
failure_patterns.prevention: Check weather, increase thrust margin, reduce max tilt

sequence: GPS signal loss or multipath interference
Large innovation spike on position/velocity channels
EKF rejects GPS measurements, switches to dead reckoning
Position estimate drifts, possible fly-away if prolonged
failure_patterns.prevention: Ensure clear sky view, enable GPS checks, tune EKF gates
